content.description: This is one of the nicest lines less than V2 at Arthur's. This is a nice technical, footwork-oriented arete.
content.protection: A pad.  A spotter for anyone near their limit.
content.location:
From

Shotput

, continue on the access trail straight, do not turn uphill for Snake and Skewer, keep going straight, passing several smaller boulders (Black Beauty and Gill Boulder). On the next large boulder up right - the Handcrack Boulder - circle around the boulder to the right.

Find the arete, a little uphill and right of

Onsight

, and a little to the left of the

Handcrack

.

content.description:
SDS in the obvious, right-facing corner.  This climb follows the crack/seam up and right to big moves at the lip near a tree.  More info can be found here:

nococlimbing.org/climbing
content.location:
It is just down from

Child Birth

.

content.description:
Starting on obvious underclings at chest height, make a big left move to an obvious "shotput" pinch.  Then roll right delicately on crystal crimps to slopey notch arete and up.

A bomber foot block immediately above start broke recently.  Now it is harder for the grade and potentially height-dependent but very do-able.
content.protection: One or two pads is plenty.  Decent spotter is helpful to keep climber on the trail should they try to go dynamic and miss.
content.location:
This is right off the trail, above

Ode to Failure

and

The Syringe

, downhill from

Childbirth

.  It is easily identifiable by large pine growing out of base of boulder.

content.description:
This is a fun, little, edgy and knobby climb.  This one sneaks out the right side of the overhang next to

Everett Overhang

.
content.protection: A pad.  A spotter would be nice.
content.location:
From

Shotput

, continue on the access trail straight, do not turn uphill for Snake and the Skewer, keep going straight, passing several smaller boulders (Black Beauty and Gill Boulder). On the next large boulder up right - the Handcrack Boulder - find the downhill, West face. This climbs sneaks out the right side of the overhang.

content.description: This is a nice warmup, especially if you like jam on your cracks.  This can be dirty on occasion, but you can easily sweep out the dust and pine needles to reveal a decent crack climb.
content.protection: A pad.  A spotter for those not used to jamming, especially for the exit moves.
content.location:
From

Shotput

, continue on the access trail straight, do not turn uphill for Snake and Skewer, keep going straight, passing several smaller boulders (Black Beauty and Gill Boulder). On the next large boulder up right - the Handcrack Boulder - circle around the boulder to the right.

Pass the

Southeast Arete

and find the line that heads up a slabby to vertical hand crack.

content.description: This is a nice problem on the Handcrack Bulder.  A few slab moves send you into the overhang.  A little power at the lip is all you need.
content.location:
From

Shotput

, continue on the access trail straight, do not turn uphill for Snake and Skewer, keep going straight, passing several smaller boulders (Black Beauty and Gill Boulder).  On the next large boulder up right - the Handcrack Boulder - find the downhill, West face.  This climbs the left side of the overhang, just left of

Onsight

.

content.description: This is a short problem.  Bust the move off of the signature, blocky holds, and all you have left is a couple of top out moves.
content.protection: A pad and spotter are nice to have.
content.location:
Approach as per

Snake and the Skewer Area

, and you will find this problem a few yards left of

Snake and the Skewer

.
